metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass the arm-ttk test, 'Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded'. Instead the `workspace-location` derived from the log analytics workspace is used.
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
subscription id where Microsoft Sentinel is configured
resource group name where Microsoft Sentinel is configured
the log analytics workspace enabled for Microsoft Sentinel

connectorUiConfig.title: Snowflake (using REST API) (Preview)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The Snowflake data connector provides the capability to ingest Snowflake login logs and query logs into Microsoft Sentinel using the Snowflake SQL Rest API. Refer to Snowflake documentation for more information.

sampleQueries.description: Get a sample of Snowflake logs

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

customs.name: Snowflake SQL REST API access
customs.description: Access to the Snowflake API is required.

instructionSteps.description:
Follow the [Snowflake instructions here](https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/oauth-custom) to create a Security Integration for Azure. You will need to set the Redirect URL for it as the Azure portal.
 Through those instructions, you should get the Client ID, Client Secret, Account URL.
 Fill out the form below with that information.
instructionSteps.title: Connect to Snowflake SQL REST API to collect logs in Microsoft Sentinel
